WorkItem.ClosedComment: closing as duplicate of issue 11429, please vote on that if strong naming is important for you
WorkItem.Description:
Hello,

May I propose that the NAudio project is strongly signed (using .snk-file, no password) so that it can be used as-is together with other strongly named assemblies? It'll still be usable with unsigned assemblies so backwards compatibility shouldn't be an issue.

Great library, btw!

Regards,

Per

Comments.Message: I've never felt the need to strong name NAudio since it is open source, and didn't really fancy having to manage a secret snk file, but from this link http://stackoverflow.com/questions/839697/do-i-need-to-secure-my-strong-name-key-file-for-an-open-source-project, it seems that an option would be just to create a snk file and include it in the NAudio repository. Will try to get this done for NAudio 1.5
